newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia Gazprom shares see free regional trade.
newsitem.headline: Russia Gazprom shares see free regional trade.

text.p: Four Russian regional stock exchanges will start freely trading shares in natural gas producer Gazprom as of July 1, a spokesman for Russia's main securities watchdog said on Friday.

A government order said the Moscow Stock Exchange, St Petersburg Stock Exchange, Yekaterinburg Stock Exchange and Siberian Stock Exchange, the latter located in Novosibirsk, which were allowed to start trading the shares on June 1, must observe current rules of trade until July 1.
Those rules require that Gazprom be given the right of first refusal in all sales of its shares.

"Now it will be different," said Yuri Kotler, spokesman for the Federal Commission for the Securities Market. "Now there will be just four trading floors and the Federal Commission will control the proportion (of shares held by) non-residents."
He said Gazprom's right of refusal would not be in force on those exchanges, which currently trade only small amounts of any share.
Another government body, the Federal Securities Corporation, currently organises regular auctions and electronic trading sessions of Gazprom shares in which the right of refusal is also waived.
Trade in Gazprom shares is strictly limited. Foreigners can hold only nine percent of all shares and must hold them as American Depositary Shares which allow trade abroad.
Kotler said that Gazprom shares would be gradually moved out of the Russian Trading System (RTS) after July 1.
